results.title: All you have to do is dig
results.brief_description: Throughout the year “fossickers” fill the mining towns of Coober Pedy, Andamooka and Lightning Ridge in Central Australia, searching for opals to make their fortune. The professional miners with their bizarre mining machinery, the casual people and the “noodlers” - weekend searchers.

results.title: All the World's a Stage
results.brief_description: Follows the progress of three students from their auditions before John Houseman for the Drama Division at the famous Juilliard School for performing arts, through to rigorous training to become professional actors.

results.title: All the difference
results.brief_description: Examines the effect pollution can have on a future generation by contrasting the beautiful land of America as described by Walt Whitman, Robert Frost, Robert Penn Warren, Henry Wadsworth Longfellow and other poets, with the pollution of the environment as seen in the smog-obscured skies, dead waters and debris-strewn streets.

results.title: All that mighty heart
results.creator_credit: R.K. Neilson Baxter, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Federation
results.brief_description: A portrait of daily life in London. Transport plays a vital part in the scene as rush hour and lull alternate, and as work is replaced by leisure, or the evening gaiety of the West End entertainment. Under the streets another tube line is being tunnelled to carry the increasing number of workers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: R.K. Neilson Baxter, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Federation

results.title: All star casting
results.creator_credit: Edward Cook and Big Six Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes the processes employed in a large British foundry. Begins in the pattern makers shop and then shows making of sand moulds. After pouring, the moulds are allowed to cool and then broken to remove castings. Moulding sand is collected for re-use. Shock blasting is employed to clean castings after which they are machined and annealed. Castings manufactured by the firm include parts for tractors, fork lifting trucks, cranes, excavators and internal combustion engines.

results.title: All rounder
results.brief_description: This interesting vignette from the Movietone News programs compares a motor vehicle driver to an all-round cricketer. Most cricketers specialise in one aspect of the game, but an all-rounder can prove a most valuable asset to a team, as Richie Benaud did for the Australian team in the test series. Drivers, too need all-round skills; reckless driving and a lack of concentration are fatal on both the oval and the road! No other credits available.

results.title: All over the shop
results.creator_credit: Peter Pickering, J.D. Chambers, Data Film Productions and European Productivity Agency
results.brief_description: Shows examples of how Work Study has been applied in the reorganization of departments in three different firms. In the packing department of a large pharmaceutical works the flow of work was improved, the individual jobs made easier by the use of simple cheap apparatus made for the purpose. Unnecessary movement of personnel was eliminated in the making-up department of a hosiery firm by adoption of a new layout involving the use of conveyor belts. In the sheet metal shop of an electronic instrument firm, Work Study was used to relieve the shortage of skilled operatives.
